result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Patrick Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew Patrick Bradley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew Patrick Bradley was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

chargeModifiers.descr: Attempt (Crime is Class I Felony is Guilty of Class A Misdemeanor)

supervisions.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. *Bond on file to be applied to restitution. *Clerk of Court to pay out restitution to victims as it is paid.  *Payment Plan:  $50.00 per month, commencing on 9/1/16

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Patrick Bradley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Warrant Cancellation MASO

Defendant  paid $50 to quash the warrant per Judge Bult's direction
To continue making monthly payments
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Matthew Patrick Bradley in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Restitution has been paid in full to the COC office.  Atty Hendee asks that that restitution be paid out to the victims.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2.  Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.
Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Restitution = $965.00
Bond to be applied to restitution
COC office to pay out Restitution to the victims.
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2016

Counts 1 & 3 to be dismissed.

Amended Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)
- DA's office is not charging the surcharge
Plea hearing on July 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)

Final pre-trial at 05-27-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 07-14-2016 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that his client was hospitalized for a couple days and asks the court to allow him to proceed.  Court states that there is not an authorization but he will allow to proceed.  Atty Gumz asks for a trial to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial. 
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Return date at 02-18-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Matthew Patrick Bradley in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he has spoke with Atty Gumz on possible settlement but the parties do not have resolution at this time.  Atty Gumz agrees and asks that this be reset.
Atty Gumz states that if a Not Guilty plea has been entered, the defendant will do so.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea has already been entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
State's
STATEMENT OF COMPLIANCE
Return date at 01-07-2016 03:30 pm
*Maintain absolute sobriety - zero tolerance.  *No contact or go on the premises of Foxy's or Mason Station in Briggsville.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause.  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  
  Defendant would like to contact the public defender.
BY THE COURT:  Set for return.

**Atty Hendee states he filed incorrectly and this should not have a CF case number as all counts are misdemeanors.
BY THE COURT:  If it can be changed by the clerk to a CM number, that will be ordered.  If not, the DA to file a new complaint.

Defendant Matthew Patrick Bradley by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests cash bond with conditions.  Defendant requests smaller cash bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets cash bond.  Return date scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
